name: Veneer, hardwood, dry, at veneer mill, E
description:
All weights given on an ovendry basis. All moisture contents are on an ovendry basis.  MC% =(weight of water in wood / weight of oven dry wood) *100. Reference to specific gravities use oven dry mass and volumes at specified moisture contents.  Reference to densities use mass and volume at specified moistrue contents.

Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

category.name: 3212: Veneer, Plywood, and Engineered Wood Product Manufacturing

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Questionnaires from  4 veneer and 5 flooring mills in the E. United States representing 32 states.
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Only mass allocation factors are available for the multi-functional processes (disregard economic allocation factor values-they are mass allocation factors).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: E= Eastern US United States. The states included MN, IA, MO, WI, IL, NJ, OH, IN, MI, WV, PA, MD, DW, NJ, NY, ME, VT, NH, RI, MA, CT, VA, KY, AR, LA, MS, AL, FL,GA, NC, SC, and TN

exchanges.description: Based on a weighted average green density and specific gravity of 613 kg/m3 and 0.578.  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 6.0%.

flow.name: Veneer; hardwood; dry; at veneer mill
categoryPath: 3212: Veneer, Plywood, and Engineered Wood Product Manufacturing

exchanges.description: Based on a weighted average green density and specific gravity of 613 kg/m3 and 0.578.  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 6.0%.

exchanges.description: Two mills reporting VOCs during veneer drying.
Amount of natural gas consumed during conditioning.  Represents 14.3% of mill use of natural gas; proxy for propane

defaultProvider.name: Natural gas, combusted in industrial equipment

flow.name: Natural gas, combusted in industrial equipment, 1.357 m3/kg, 52.13 MJ/kg

exchanges.description: EPA data (total hydrocarbons as C per EPA Method 25A)
One mill reported acetaldehyde emissions during veneer drying.
Amount of diesel consumed during veneer drying.  Represents 5% of mill use of diesel
Amount of gasoline consumed during veneer drying.  Represents 14.3% of mill use of gasoline
Amount of electricity consumed during veneer drying.  Represents 1.2% of mill use of electricity. 1 kilowatt hour = 3.6 megajoule.
